info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:23PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Weld, Broomfield, northwestern Adams and southeastern Boulder Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 321 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Niwot, or 27 miles north of Denver, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thornton, Westminster, Broomfield, Northglenn, Lafayette, Louisville, Erie, Federal Heights, Frederick, Dacono, Todd Creek and Niwot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
